oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Braden-Sinai School: interior view of french doors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of the interior of the building. Three french doors with double transoms are visible. These were formerly double hung windows.

The Braden-Sinai School was built circa 1920 with possible support from the Julius Rosenwald Fund. It was used as for a Head Start Program and then remained vacant for 18 years. By 1995, it became a residential home and the tall, double-hung windows were replaced with French doors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings; African American schools -- Tennessee
